title: At least 9 dead, 10 injured after a train hit a passenger bus in north-central Mexico
text:
Nine people have died and at least 10 were injured after a passenger bus was hit by a train on Friday morning in North-central Mexico on Friday.

The accident happened when the driver of the public transport bus tried to drive across a crossing with a cargo train approaching in San Juan del Rio, a city in the state of Querétaro.

All nine of the dead were on the bus at the time of the crash.

The state civil defense office said the crash occurred shortly 10am local time and at was caused 'by the reckless action of the driver of the vehicle who tried to outrun the train.'

A train hit a passenger bus in the north-central Mexican state of Querétaro on Friday morning, leaving nine people dead and 10 injured

First responders provide medical assistance to those who were injured when a 21-year-old passenger bus tried to 'outrun' a cargo train in Mexico

Residents in San Juan del Rio, a city in the Mexican state of Querétaro, walk around the tragic accident scene

According to the state police, the 21-year-old driver was transported to a local hospital and detained pending an investigation.

The state civil defense office added that eight of the injured, including the driver, were in serious condition.

Two other passengers were listed in delicate condition.

Paramedics provide treatment to injured customers after the driver of a passenger bus they were traveling tried to 'outrun' a train at a crossing and was hit by a train in north-central Mexico

Bystanders gather around the deadly scene of an accident after a train crashed into a bus

Mexican official (pictured) reported that the 21-year-old bus driver was hospitalized and under the custody of the state police

The city government provided an on-site team of psychologists for the family members grieving the loss of their loved ones.

Images of the scene suggest the crossing had warning signs.

The bus landed upside down several feet from the train tracks.
